title: [CONCEPT] Base Caitlyn Visual Update Concept
body:
This is a VU idea for Caitlyn {{champion:51}} .

SORRY bois ..but I wish she has more clothes.

Inspired by Steampunk style, and more "hex-tech" features for her weapon.

Hope yall like my art <3

The art is good and I like the idea of this as a skin. Maybe as a play Victorian style get up for Cait. But I'm not sure I'd enjoy this as her base look

The look is cute, but I don't feel like it fits the direction they've taken Caitlyn in the lore. They've taken her the tomboyish route, where she prefers to get dirty, scouting the city, casing suspects etc, so I honestly don't think she needs to be a skirt considering her level of activity. I think a more old fashioned version of how she looks in Pulsefire is the best route for her, with the long coat with tails, and the pants. She needs to keep the full top hat though, it's very distinctly her style and it's pretty core to her profile. Your upper half of her looks fine, she just needs to lose the skirts.

http://i.imgur.com/xrKTKvh.png

I prefer this tbh
Ah, I was referencing the same rework for her in my comment, but I prefer the version without the big collar. ^^

> [{quoted}](name=Arcade Lulu,realm=EUNE,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8QATUv9G,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-02-27T21:44:00.235+0000)
>
> http://i.imgur.com/xrKTKvh.png
> 
> I prefer this tbh

never seen that before, that's a really good one :O

It is well made, we all have to admire your talent.

But I have to point out that this design does not really solve the biggest problem when it comes to Caitlyns visuals.
Riot has introduced aesthetical standards for the regions, specific patterns, colours, themes and other stuff representing the factions.
Caitlyns outfit doesn't really fit into the Piltover aesthetic anymore, nor does it represent her position as a Piltovian sheriff well.

Your concept, while pretty, still has pretty much the same problems.
Examples for that:

- The sheriff star. I know why you went with it, being a symbol for sheriffs known from old western movies and stuff. And that is the problem, it is a relict of old western movies. You definitely wouldn't expect a Piltovian law enforcer to have a sheriff star.
- Pretty dress, while fitting better in the Piltovian aesthetic than the old design (good job on that), does not represent her position well. Look, for example, at Camille. She is a female champion from Piltover with _kinda_ a similar position like her. But her clothes are more functional, look more like an uniform than something a fair lady wears on a gentle sunday.
- Hextech rifle. I understand that you wanted a more "steampunkish" look for it, hence the colours. However, hextech in LoL has a very own colour palette. Silver, blue, and brass (or is it gold? I am sry, I have a red weakness) are dominant and give it a more sci-fi look than steampunkish. 

Besides that, there is quite some stuff I like. You did a great job on her hair in my opinion, really gives her another feeling. And I like that you played with her hat a bit, even if it most definitely has to stay a top hat. It is too iconic to let it go.

All in all: Really good execution, but you should probably rethink the design in general a bit. There is another fan concept in the internet for a visual update for her, which solves alot the problems I mentioned:
http://i.imgur.com/WXqFoEH.png

Giving her an outfit that resembles a uniform more works better for her in my opinion.
I hope you stay motivated and show us your art, tho. You have great talent and your work has alot of potential. Maybe you might even become a Rioter some day.

> [{quoted}](name=SatomiKun,realm=EUW,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8QATUv9G,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-02-27T23:00:13.594+0000)
>
> - Hextech rifle. I understand that you wanted a more "steampunkish" look for it, hence the colours. However, hextech in LoL has a very own colour palette. Silver, blue, and brass (or is it gold? I am sry, I have a red weakness) are dominant and give it a more sci-fi look than steampunkish. 
 
A note on the rifle. Her rifle was made SPECIFICALLY by her parents for her as a birthday present. It's not mass produced, it doesn't come from any of the major houses that specialize in Hextech manufacturing, it was made completely custom by her parents. Several Zaunites and Piltovans in game make comments about the antiquity of her rifle, and mock it's appearance, which then tells us that her rifle DOES NOT follow the standard, modern aesthetic of current Hextech weaponry. So her rifle can look pretty much however it wants and still be canon in the lore and game, because it's been shown that it doesn't look new or fit in with the rest of Piltover's technology.

While it is true that it isn't mass produced, it can not "look how it wants" in my opinion.

OPs version of the weapon looks kinda... sloppy. It looks more like a weapon that I would imagine from Zaun. Caitlyns parents surely would create something elegant for their daughter, not like it was made from scraps from a junkyard. So it can't look like whatever, it must fulfill some class.

> [{quoted}](name=SatomiKun,realm=EUW,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8QATUv9G,comment-id=000700000000,timestamp=2019-02-28T20:34:44.307+0000)

> OPs version of the weapon looks kinda... sloppy. It looks more like a weapon that I would imagine from Zaun. Caitlyns parents surely would create something elegant for their daughter, not like it was made from scraps from a junkyard. So it can't look like whatever, it must fulfill some class.

It doesn't have to fulfill any class. If her parents were expert engineers, but didn't have ANY eye for aesthetic or artistic design, they could make a quality item that looks really ugly. Craftsmanship and artistic design are not intrinsically linked when talking about machinery. I mean hell, that's almost what the entire steampunk aesthetic is based off of - machinery without artistic value merged with Victorian artistic designs and fashion.

Piltover is all about upper class and Caitlyns parents were no no-names. Even if they themselves had no idea about artistic design, you expect their parents to get someone to do it for them. It was an important birthday gift for her, I doubt that her parents just were like "looks crap, but hey, as long as it works".

They wanted to get their daughter something special and it was planned long in advance. The rifle should look aesthetically pleasing.

> [{quoted}](name=SatomiKun,realm=EUW,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=8QATUv9G,comment-id=00070000000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-28T21:18:54.064+0000)

> 
> They wanted to get their daughter something special and it was planned long in advance. The rifle should look aesthetically pleasing.

Yeah, but I don't think the OP's rifle looks bad at all. It's not standard Hextech looks, but it's by no means bad.

I dig the steampunk thematics myself, but I try to consider the world they live in. And how I imagine Piltover, I would guess this is considered "ugly" by their standards and design examples we have at hand.

Nothing personal, just the world should stay coherent.
